Description: Small fragment of a scarab made of steatite, broken by drilling the perforation through it. Preserved is a part of the back showing the suture in a single line and the separation line of the prothorax. A small second line where the humeral callosities are shown, only preserved on one side though. The head is distinguishable, but the rest is broken off. Remains of glaze preserved in a small area at the elytra. The one preserved side shows three separate formed legs with small notches for the hairs. The rest is broken off.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
